ai.question: What is the function of the planning and provisioning team within the ISP organization?

choice.text: answering help desk calls from customers
identifying whether existing network hardware and circuits are available

ai.question: What are two characteristics of a scalable network? (Choose two.)

choice.text: grows in size without impacting existing users
is not as reliable as a small network
contains modular devices that allow for expansion

ai.question: Why do multiple ISPs connect to an IXP or a NAP? (Choose two.)

choice.text: to gain access to each other's networks
to provide dial-up access for their customers

ai.question: A network administrator can successfully ping the server at www.cisco.com, but cannot ping the company web server located at an ISP in another city. Which tool or command would help identify the specific router where the packet was lost or delayed?
What makes it possible for email to be sent and received on a wide variety of devices, including cell phones, PDAs, laptops, and desktop computers?

choice.text: All of the devices run the same operating system software.
There is a single provider of email server software.
The devices use the same email client software, so they are compatible.
Email software is written using standards and protocols that ensure compatibility.

ai.question: Which connectivity option would be a good choice for a large university with three campus locations in the same major city?
Which statement describes a function provided by Tier 3 Internet Service Providers?

choice.text: peer with other similarly sized ISPs to form the global Internet backbone
own and operate undersea fiber runs to provide Internet connectivity across oceans
connect individuals and small businesses to the Internet
provide the link between Tier 2 ISPs and the global Internet backbone

ai.question: Refer to the exhibit. Host A has multiple paths to the web server. Based on the output of the tracert command and the IP addresses that are given, which path was used to reach the destination?
Why do small businesses and individuals choose DSL and cable connectivity instead of T3 connections?

choice.text: DSL and cable connectivity offers higher speeds than T3 connections.
T3 connections do not provide enough upload bandwidth to meet their needs.
T3 connections are usually more expensive than DSL or cable options.
T3 connections are less reliable than DSL or cable.
